Change.Description:
BUG: Distance filter should use consistent defaults
Distance maps are commonly regarded as know to be a way to compute exact Euclidean distance, but with the default values, that was not the case, forcing the user to change those values each time to get exact results.
In order to make the all distance maps behave consistently, they should default to the natural Euclidean distance measures in physical space.
The filters are configurable to run faster but with results that require end-user care to ensure that they are used properly (i.e. distances can be squares of either physical or voxel distances).
